New Records: Shohei Ohtani went deep leading off the game and stole his 41st and 42nd bases in pursuit of becoming the first major leaguer in history with 50 homers and 50 stolen bases in a season
Ohtani gave the Dodgers a career-high 104 runs this season, bettering his mark of 103 set in 2021
Key Match Events: Teoscar Hernández hit a go-ahead, three-run homer in the third inning
Mookie Betts had a RBI single and Hernández belted his 28th homer with two outs
Baltimore cut it to 5-4 on Ryan O’Hearn’s RBI double into the right-field corner that chased Dodgers starter Walker Buehler in the fifth
Pre-Game Insights: Shohei Ohtani and his dog Decoy handled the ceremonial first pitch
The Japanese superstar is on track to become the first major leaguer in history with 50 homers and 50 stolen bases in a season
Post-Match Reflections: Any big moment he seems to rise to the occasion
We knew going into the game this was going to be a tough lineup and a tough pitcher to face
We certainly didn’t help Walker out
Miscellaneous Highlights: Teoscar Hernández hit a solo home run during the first inning
Orioles: 2B-SS Jorge Mateo had elbow surgery in Texas and is done for the season
Dodgers: RHP Jack Flaherty has a sore wrist with minimal swelling after taking a comebacker off it on Tuesday
Others: Buehler got to the dugout and fired his glove on the bench in frustration
Buehler has been fighting to regain his pre-Tommy John surgery form
Orioles' LHP Cade Povich (1-6, 6.10) gave up five runs on a career-high eight hits, including two homers, against Houston last week
